newsitem.title: UK: Eurobond trade ideas- Go flatter in marks.
newsitem.headline: Eurobond trade ideas- Go flatter in marks.

text.p: Eurobond analysts' latest trade recommendations focused on marks, dollars and yen. Sanwa International suggested buying the 6.50 percent LKB Baden-Wuerttemberg bond due 2008 and selling the 4.875 percent bond Sudwest Capital Markets bond with a 2002 maturity.
Sanwa recommended flattening trades in marks after Bundesbank council member Reimut Jochimsen suggested on Wednesday there was no need for any more rate cuts in Germany
Following are latest trade ideas, compiled by Reuters:
SELL Sudwest LB Capital Markets 4.875 pct 01/02

STRATEGY This switch gives a yield pick-up of 129 basis points. The current spread is seven b.p. below the six month high and 19 b.p. above the low. With the mark yield curve being so steep there is a wide carrying cost when buying longer-dated maturities.
STRATEGY This trade offers a credit pick-up plus a yield pick-up of nine b.p. There is also a cash takeout of over five points.
STRATEGY The move into the French government agency gives a credit pick-up and a yield pick-up of six b.p.
BUY Export-Import Bank of Japan 6.50 pct 10/05
STRATEGY The switch into Eximbank offers a yield pick-up of four b.p., a 1.5 points cash takeout and increased liquidity.
STRATEGY This credit neutral shortening switch offers a seven b.p. yield pick-up.
STRATEGY This switch gives a yield give-up of around 98 b.p. compared to a recent average give-up of around 111 b.p.
